task: Give me a concise checklist to scaffold a UI in phases.

details.note: Mergeability skipped for advisory guidance tasks.

agents.name: agent-phase-sequencing
agents.lastMessage:
- **Phase 1 - Discovery & Alignment**: Deliverable: a problem brief with goals, constraints, stakeholders, dependencies, and success metrics. Exit criteria: scope baseline approved, assumptions documented, top risks logged.
- **Phase 2 - Solution Design & Sequencing**: Deliverable: architecture/design doc plus a prioritized phase plan (milestones, owners, dependencies). Exit criteria: design review passed, tradeoffs accepted, each milestone has clear acceptance criteria.
- **Phase 3 - Foundation Build**: Deliverable: working skeleton with core models/contracts, basic workflows, and CI/lint/test setup. Exit criteria: one end-to-end happy path works locally, foundation tests pass, no critical blockers remain.
- **Phase 4 - Feature Completion & Hardening**: Deliverable: agreed MVP feature set with validation, error handling, and observability. Exit criteria: committed stories completed, integration tests green, reliability/performance checks meet targets.
- **Phase 5 - Polish & Release Readiness**: Deliverable: UX/content polish, documentation/runbook, release notes, and rollout plan. Exit criteria: stakeholder/UAT sign-off, monitoring and alerts live, rollback plan verified.

- **Cross-phase checklist**: every phase closes only when outputs are reviewable, quality gates are green for that phase, unresolved risks have owners/dates, and next-phase inputs are complete.

agents.name: agent-ui-foundations
agents.lastMessage:
**Layout Structure**
- [ ] Define an app shell: `Header | Nav | Main | Optional Aside | Footer`.
- [ ] Standardize page containers (`max-width`, horizontal padding, responsive breakpoints).
- [ ] Pick one spacing scale (e.g., 4/8px rhythm) and apply it everywhere.
- [ ] Establish layout primitives (`Stack`, `Inline`, `Grid`, `Container`, `Spacer`).
- [ ] Add page-level loading, empty, and error slots in the shell.

**Component Primitives**
- [ ] Ship core primitives first: `Button`, `Input`, `Select`, `Checkbox`, `Radio`, `Textarea`, `Modal`, `Tooltip`, `Tabs`, `Toast`.
- [ ] Ensure all primitives support `disabled`, `loading`, `error`, `success`, and size variants.
- [ ] Enforce accessibility defaults: labels, keyboard nav, focus-visible, ARIA where needed.
- [ ] Keep primitives style-agnostic and compose them into feature components later.
- [ ] Add visual/interaction tests for each primitive state.

**Design Tokens**
- [ ] Create token tiers: `base` (raw values) and `semantic` (usage-driven names).
- [ ] Cover token categories: color, typography, spacing, radius, shadow, border, motion, z-index.
- [ ] Use semantic names (`bg.surface`, `text.muted`, `border.default`) over hard-coded values.
- [ ] Define light/dark (or brand) themes via token swaps, not component overrides.
- [ ] Store tokens in one source of truth and generate platform outputs from it.

**Navigation**
- [ ] Define route map and ownership (`public`, `authenticated`, `admin`, etc.).
- [ ] Choose persistent nav pattern (`top`, `side`, `hybrid`) and mobile behavior.
- [ ] Ensure active route, breadcrumbs, and back behavior are consistent.
- [ ] Support deep-linking for key views and filter states.
- [ ] Add route guards plus route-level loading/error boundaries.

**Data/State Boundaries**
- [ ] Separate server state (API/cache) from UI state (local interaction).
- [ ] Centralize data fetching/caching strategy (query keys, TTL, invalidation).
- [ ] Keep mutations close to features; normalize optimistic updates and rollback rules.
- [ ] Avoid global state for ephemeral UI state; scope state to nearest feature boundary.
- [ ] Define clear contracts for data shape, error types, and retry behavior.

agents.name: agent-quality-gates
agents.lastMessage:
- [ ] `Phase 0: Requirements` — Accessibility criteria mapped to WCAG 2.2 AA; target breakpoints/devices agreed; performance budgets defined; release owner + rollback owner assigned.
- [ ] `Phase 1: Design` — Contrast/focus order reviewed; layouts validated at `320/375/768/1024/1440`; expected perf impact estimated; monitoring/analytics requirements defined.
- [ ] `Phase 2: Build (Local)` — Keyboard-only + labels/ARIA checks pass; no overflow/cutoff at target widths; bundle/render changes within budget; feature flags and migration safety verified.
- [ ] `Phase 3: PR/CI Gate` — `0` critical automated accessibility violations; viewport/screenshot regression checks pass; Lighthouse/Web Vitals gate passes (`LCP <2.5s`, `INP <200ms`, `CLS <0.1` target); tests/docs/changelog/runbook updates included.
- [ ] `Phase 4: Staging/UAT` — Screen reader smoke test on key flows; real-device responsive spot checks complete; synthetic + load checks meet SLO; deploy + rollback dry run successful.
- [ ] `Phase 5: Release Go/No-Go` — No open Sev1/Sev2 quality issues; canary metrics within budget; approvals captured; on-call + rollback trigger thresholds confirmed.
- [ ] `Phase 6: Post-Release (24–72h)` — Monitor accessibility feedback, responsive regressions, and live performance p75; log findings in post-release review with action owners.
